${modID}:PickUp.NAME: Pick Up
DESCRIPTIONS: You suddenly find yourself back on Rhodes Island's promenade. You spot #y a wallet at your feet.
You wait a while in place, and from a distance, you see a Filin coming your way.
You pick up the wallet, feeling the weight of coins inside through the leather. Best to leave quickly.
A wallet lying conspicuously on the ground? Too suspicious, better act like you didn't see it.
Jessica expresses her gratitude to you and invites you for afternoon tea.
You join Jessica for her lavish afternoon tea, delightful. (Restore all life, increase maximum life by 15)
You decline the invitation; there are more important matters at hand. As you leave, she hands you a gift from the Doctor.
OPTIONS: No one around, pick it up.

${modID}:RhodesIslandSafeHouse.NAME: Rhodes Island Safe House
DESCRIPTIONS: You turn a corner, and before you is a familiar door. Behind the door seems to be a commonly seen backup safe house from Rhodes Island's various locations. Do you want to check it out?
You use the terminal to unlock the safe house. Inside, though a bit rudimentary, it has all the basic amenities and can serve as a temporary rest stop.

You try to forcefully break into the safe house and accidentally scratch your arm on a sharp piece of metal. Despite being a bit rudimentary inside, the safe house has all the basic amenities and can serve as a temporary rest stop.
Better to keep moving, slip away.
You use the medical kit on the wall and rest on the bed for a while. Feeling much better, it's time to leave.
You search the room and find a #y relic! It's time to leave.
You upgrade your equipment with the tools left behind in the room; it's time to go.
OPTIONS: Randomly upgrade two cards. If the deck has *Training, upgrade once.

${modID}:UPGSkill.NAME: Rhodes Island Training Room
DESCRIPTIONS: You suddenly find yourself back in the Rhodes Island training room, the equipment in front of you so familiar. Do you want to practice your skills?
You start from scratch and gain #ySkill1.
You advance your skills, losing #ySkill1 and gaining #ySkill2.
You advance your skills, losing #ySkill1 and gaining #ySkill3.
Nothing new to learn, slip away.
You practice your existing skills.
This also works in card text! But not on keywords.
OPTIONS: [Nothing more to learn] Upgrade one card. If the deck has *Training, upgrade once.
